pull.title: rest: bugfix, fix crash error when calling `/deploymentinfo`
pull.body:
Calling `/deploymentinfo` passing a valid blockhash makes bitcoind to crash. It happens because we're pushing a JSON value of type array when it expects type object. See:
```cpp
jsonRequest.params = UniValue(UniValue::VARR);
```
```cpp
jsonRequest.params.pushKV("blockhash", hash_str);
```

This PR fixes it by changing `pushKV` to `push_back` and adds more test coverage.

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

issue.title: rpc: Be able to access RPC parameters by name
issue.body:
Although we accept named RPC parameters, we still access the parameters by position within the RPC implementations. This PR makes it possible to access these parameters directly by name. This is achieved by holding the parameters in a separate `JSONRPCParameters` class which contains mappings from both name to value, and position to value. Two `operator[]` methods are implemented which can accept both strings and ints. This allows for backwards compatibility, while also allowing for future implementation to access the parameters by name.

The processing of named arguments ends up being entirely overhauled in order to be able to store the mappings to the parameters.

Based on #26485 to avoid conflicting with it.

events.message: rest: bugfix, fix crash error when calling `/deploymentinfo`
test: add coverage for `/deploymentinfo` passing a blockhash

events.body:
Force-pushed addressing https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27853/files#r1226690678

Thanks @stickies-v for the review.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -420,6 +420,11 @@ def run_test(self):
 
         deployment_info = self.nodes[0].getdeploymentinfo()
         assert_equal(deployment_info, self.test_rest_request('/deploymentinfo'))
+        assert_equal(deployment_info, self.test_rest_request(f"/deploymentinfo/{bb_hash}"))
+
+        self.generate(self.wallet, 10, sync_fun=self.no_op)
+        deployment_info = self.nodes[0].getdeploymentinfo(bb_hash)
+        assert_equal(deployment_info, self.test_rest_request(f"/deploymentinfo/{bb_hash}"))
comments.body: Why do we need this repeated test? At the very least it seems orthogonal to the PR?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -420,6 +420,11 @@ def run_test(self):
 
         deployment_info = self.nodes[0].getdeploymentinfo()
         assert_equal(deployment_info, self.test_rest_request('/deploymentinfo'))
+        assert_equal(deployment_info, self.test_rest_request(f"/deploymentinfo/{bb_hash}"))
+
+        self.generate(self.wallet, 10, sync_fun=self.no_op)
+        deployment_info = self.nodes[0].getdeploymentinfo(bb_hash)
+        assert_equal(deployment_info, self.test_rest_request(f"/deploymentinfo/{bb_hash}"))
comments.body:
Yeah I get that, but I don't see why we wouldn't just run the hash-specified test immediately on the older hash to avoid doing this twice? Also just querying the previous hash seems more efficient than running generate?

Upon further thought, I think it does indeed make sense to include it in this PR.

```diff
diff --git a/test/functional/interface_rest.py b/test/functional/interface_rest.py
index 559249101..1ba8f60d9 100755
--- a/test/functional/interface_rest.py
+++ b/test/functional/interface_rest.py
@@ -420,11 +420,10 @@ class RESTTest (BitcoinTestFramework):
 
         deployment_info = self.nodes[0].getdeploymentinfo()
         assert_equal(deployment_info, self.test_rest_request('/deploymentinfo'))
-        assert_equal(deployment_info, self.test_rest_request(f"/deploymentinfo/{bb_hash}"))
 
-        self.generate(self.wallet, 10, sync_fun=self.no_op)
-        deployment_info = self.nodes[0].getdeploymentinfo(bb_hash)
-        assert_equal(deployment_info, self.test_rest_request(f"/deploymentinfo/{bb_hash}"))
+        previous_bb_hash = self.nodes[0].getblockhash(self.nodes[0].getblockcount() - 1)
+        deployment_info = self.nodes[0].getdeploymentinfo(previous_bb_hash)
+        assert_equal(deployment_info, self.test_rest_request(f"/deploymentinfo/{previous_bb_hash}"))
 
         non_existing_blockhash = '42759cde25462784395a337460bde75f58e73d3f08bd31fdc3507cbac856a2c4'
         resp = self.test_rest_request(f'/deploymentinfo/{non_existing_blockhash}', ret_type=RetType.OBJ, status=400)

```
